column4: what command do I need to edit this file?  sudo apt-get "what" /boot/grub/menu.lst???
or am I thinking something else?
If anyone knows the command, what is the command for this, to open/edit:  sudo apt-get "what" /boot/grub/menu.lst?
What are you trying to do?
That command doesnt make sense. Are you trying to edit /boot/grub/menu.lst ??
how do I save it now?
Yes, fsck. which it automatically runs every 30 or so boots
You'll have to unmount your partitions first.
sudo touch /forcefsck   to force it upon next boot
It will do it the next time you boot, right at the beginning.
Because the forcefsck file doesnt exist. And it needs to exist for you to force fscking at the next boot
